title: Our guide to wearing the minimalist trend, for every shape and size
text:
Sometimes it’s the simplest of fashion aesthetics that is the hardest to get right. Minimalism returns to the catwalk season after season and is about clean, simple shapes, clever lines and subtle plays on proportion and texture. It’s a balancing act that is tricky to achieve, but is timeless when done well.

Céline, under Phoebe Philo, was once the go-to for a quietly luxurious look, and two years since she left the French house, brands from the high street to Bond Street are still jostling to fill the space she left behind.
